intro: Thelypodium crispum, commonly known as the curly thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes carnations and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, bristly hairs. Thelypodium crispum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
